授業目的:
-The purpose of this course is to help students improve their overall writing skills in English.
-Writing will focus on understanding and writing English paragraphs.
-Course content will help students understand differences in writing styles, such as formal and informal.
-Students will learn to write for a variety of purposes, including academic and practical.
-There will be a focus on understanding the organization and parts of written work.
-Writing activities will also help students improve their critical thinking skills.
-Students will be able to work with and help their classmates.
-The main writing task in semester one will be to write a formal email.
到達目標:
• Students will improve their overall writing skills in English.
• Students will have a comfortable classroom atmosphere that helps learning and cooperation.
• Students will learn to use a writing process to improve their writing skills.
• Students will learn about different parts of written work. This includes understanding and writing: Topic sentences / Supporting sentences / Concluding sentences.
• Students will learn to organize and write their ideas in different ways.
• Students will learn to edit their own and others’ written work.
• Students will improve their grammar and punctuation in writing.
• Students will learn about using signal words and phrases to organize their writing.
• Students will learn about different kinds of writing. For example, writing descriptions, writing information by time order, and writing information by spatial order.
• Students will learn to write informal emails and formal / business emails.
• Students will learn writing skills for a variety of purposes, including practical, academic, and professional purposes.
• Students will improve their ability to work independently (alone) and cooperatively (with others).
• Students will improve their cultural understanding.
授業方法: Most course content will be delivered using a process approach to teaching writing. Students will be required to complete activities individually with some opportunities for collaboration and cooperative learning. Students will be required to complete a minimum of one hour of course work outside of class time, on their own, as assigned by the instructor. This work will include completing textbook work and writing assignments, preparing for class by reviewing and previewing course content, and keeping a "Writing Journal."

1st Years
5 Cautions on Credit Earning (Common Policies for Communication I, Reading I, and Writing I)
Prerequisite: Taking the TOEIC test in May required by KGU is the prerequisite for credit earning.
Absences: Four absences are considered excessive and result in automatic failure. Leaving a classroom without asking for permission, doing something else other than class activities, or sleeping are considered an absence.
Tardiness: Coming into the classroom after the bell is considered tardiness. Arrival after 30 minutes is considered an absence. Two tardy arrivals equal one absence. (Being late is not considered tardiness in case of documented delay of public transportation.)
Make-up Assessments: Make-up assessments will not be given except in cases of documented medical necessity or family emergency.
Cheating: Cheating in any quizzes, tests, projects, or assignments results in zero point on the work.
